thread.title: ‘You can NEVER triumph in our country’ MPs defiantly go back to work after terror attack
thread.title_full: ‘You can NEVER triumph in our country’ MPs defiantly go back to work after terror attack

title: ‘You can NEVER triumph in our country’ MPs defiantly go back to work after terror attack
text:
‘You can NEVER triumph in our country’ MPs defiantly go back to work after terror attack ‘You can NEVER triumph in our country’ MPs defiantly go back to work after terror attack MPs defiantly carried on their business as usual this morning in the wake of yesterday’s terror attack in the heart of Westminster. PUBLISHED: 10:02, Thu, Mar 23, 2017 | UPDATED: 10:16, Thu, Mar 23, 2017 
Less than 24 hours after a man drove a car into pedestrians before stabbing a policeman inside Parliament’s gates, MPs gathered in the House of Commons. 
Four people were left dead, including PC Keith Palmer and the attacker. 
After a minute’s silence, attended by the Prime Minister and Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn, MPs began with their scheduled business. PARLIAMENT.TV Liam Fox told MPs to 'recommit ourselves to the values this Parliament represents' Related articles LONDON TERROR ATTACK: 'He struck officer a number of times' 
Before beginning to answer International Trade questions, Cabinet minister Liam Fox said: “As we begin our questions today I think it's appropriate that we recommit ourselves to the values this Parliament represents. 
“Those who carry out such wicked and depraved actions as we saw yesterday can never triumph in our country and we must ensure that it is not violence, hatred or division but decency, goodness and tolerance that prevails in our country.” Those who carry out such wicked and depraved actions as we saw yesterday can never triumph in our country Liam Fox 
Most of Westminster is still cordoned off by police investigating yesterday’s attack, with Westminster Underground station and Westminster Bridge - where the attacker mowed down pedestrians - still closed. 
Flags are flying at half-mast across Parliament Square while a police tent has been erected within the parliamentary estate. 
More to follow...
